addIncomingPhoneNumber.doc: Adds a new phone number to your account. If a phone number is found for your request, Twilio will add it to your account

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

PhoneNumber.doc: The phone number you want to purchase. The number should be formated starting with a '+' followed by the country code					and the number in E.164 format

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number. Maximum 64 characters. Defaults to a formatted version of					the number.

VoiceUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the new phone number.

VoiceMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

VoiceFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

StatusCallback.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

StatusCallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the phone number.

SmsMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

SmsFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceCallerIdLookup.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

addIncomingPhoneNumberByAreaCode.doc: Adds a random phone number available for the area depending on the Area Code provided

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

AreaCode.doc: The area code in which you'd like a new incoming phone number. Any three digit, US area code is valid. Twilio will					provision a random phone number within this area code for you. You must include either this or a PhoneNumber parameter					to have your POST succeed.

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number. Maximum 64 characters. Defaults to a formatted version of					the number.

VoiceUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the new phone number.

VoiceMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

VoiceFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

StatusCallback.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

StatusCallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the phone number.

SmsMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

SmsFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceCallerIdLookup.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

addOutgoingCallerId.doc: Adds a new caller id to your account

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

PhoneNumber.doc: The phone number to verify. Should be formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio					will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description for the new caller ID with maximum length 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted					version of the number.

CallDelay.doc: The number of seconds, between 0 and 60, to delay before initiating the validation call. Defaults to 0.

Extension.doc: Digits to dial after connecting the verification call.

StatusCallback.doc: A URL that Twilio will request when the verification call ends to notify your app if the verification process was successful or not.

StatusCallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of the new subaccount, up to 64 characters. Defaults to "SubAccount Created at {YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM meridiam}".

deleteIncomingPhoneNumber.doc: Deletes a phone number purchased from Twilio

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

IncomingPhoneNumberSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

NotificationSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.

deleteOutgoingCallerId.doc: Deletes the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid}

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

OutgoingCallerIdSid.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

deleteParticipant.doc: Kick a participant from a conference.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

ConferenceSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

CallSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

RecordingSid.doc: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

getAccount.doc: Returns the account details for the {AccountSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

getAccountList.doc: Right now, your credentials are tied to one and only one account, so the list resource only contains your single					account.

FriendlyName.doc: Only return the Account resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.

Status.doc: Only return Account resources with the given status. Can be closed, suspended or active.

getAvailableLocalPhoneNumberList.doc: Returns a list of local AvailablePhoneNumber resource representations, each representing a phone number that is					currently available for provisioning within your account.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

IsoCountryCode.doc: The ISO country code of this phone number

AreaCode.doc: Find phone numbers in the specified Area Code. Only available for North American numbers.

Contains.doc: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z]. The '*' character will match any single					digit.

InRegion.doc: Limit results to a particular region (i.e. State/Province). Given a phone number, search within the same Region as that					number.

InPostalCode.doc: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number.

NearLatLong.doc: Given a latitude/longitude pair lat,long find geographically close numbers within Distance miles.

NearNumber.doc: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within Distance miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles.

InLata.doc: Limit results to a specific Local access and transport area (LATA). Given a phone number, search within the same LATA as					that number.

InRateCenter.doc: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number.					Requires InLata to be set as well.

Distance.doc: Specifies the search radius for a Near- query in miles. If not specified this defaults to 25 miles.

getAvailableTollFreePhoneNumberList.doc: Returns a list of toll-free AvailablePhoneNumber resource representations, each representing a phone number that is					currently available for provisioning within your account.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

IsoCountryCode.doc: The ISO country code of this phone number

Contains.doc: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z]. The '*' character will match any single					digit.

getCall.doc: Returns the single Call resource identified by {CallSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

CallSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource

getCallList.doc: Returns a list of phone calls made to and from the account identified by {AccountSid}, sorted by DateUpdated with					most-recent calls first.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

To.doc: Only show calls to this phone number.

From.doc: Only show calls from this phone number.

Status.doc: Only show calls currently in this status. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy, or no-answer.

StartTime.doc: Only show calls that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Also supports inequalities, such as StartTime(less than					or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that started at or before midnight on a date, and StartTime(greater than or equal					to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that started at or after midnight on a date.

EndTime.doc: Only show calls that ended on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Also supoprts inequalities, such as EndTime(less than or					equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that ended at or before midnight on a date, and EndTime(greater than or equal					to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that end at or after midnight on a date.

getConference.doc: Returns a representation of the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

ConferenceSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

getConferenceListForAccount.doc: Returns a list of conferences within an account identified by {AccountSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

Status.doc: Only show conferences currently in with this status. May be init, in-progress, or completed.

FriendlyName.doc: List conferences who's FriendlyName is the exact match of this string.

DateCreated.doc: Only show conferences that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as					DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or before midnight on a date, and					DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or after midnight on a date.

DateUpdated.doc: Only show conferences that were last updated on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as					DateUpdated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were last updated at or before midnight on a date, and					DateUpdated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were updated at or after midnight on a date.

getIncomingPhoneNumber.doc: Fetches the details of a phone number purchased from Twilio

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

IncomingPhoneNumberSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

getIncomingPhoneNumberList.doc: Returns a list of incoming phone number resources, each representing a phone number given to your account

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

PhoneNumber.doc: Only show the incoming phone number resources that match this pattern. You can specify partial numbers and use '*' as a					wildcard for any digit.

FriendlyName.doc: Only show the incoming phone number resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

NotificationSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

Log.doc: Only show notifications for this log, using the integer log values shown above.

MessageDate.doc: Only show notifications for this date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as					MessageDate(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or before midnight on a date, and					MessageDate(greater than or equal to )YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or after midnight on a date. When performing a					date range query with day-granularity make sure the right endpoint is midnight of the next day (e.g. to construct a					range query for all calls on YYYY-MM-DD use MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD(and)MessageDate(less					than)YYYY-MM-(DD+1)).

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

CallSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource

Log.doc: Only show notifications for this log, using the integer log values shown above.

MessageDate.doc: Only show notifications for this date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as					MessageDate(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or before midnight on a date, and					MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or after midnight on a date. When performing a					date range query with day-granularity make sure the right endpoint is midnight of the next day (e.g. to construct a					range query for all calls on YYYY-MM-DD use MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD(and)MessageDate(less					than)YYYY-MM-(DD+1)).

getOutgoingCallerId.doc: Returns a single outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid}

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

OutgoingCallerIdSid.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

getOutgoingCallerIdList.doc: Returns the list of outgoing caller ids for this account

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

PhoneNumber.doc: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this phone number.

FriendlyName.doc: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this name.

getOutgoingCallerIds.doc: Returns a list of OutgoingCallerId resource representations, each representing a Caller ID number valid for an account. The list includes paging information.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

PhoneNumber.doc: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this phone number.

FriendlyName.doc: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this name.

getParticipantForConference.doc: Returns a representation of this participant.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

ConferenceSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

CallSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.

getParticipantListForConference.doc: Returns the list of participants in the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

ConferenceSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

Muted.doc: Only show participants that are muted or unmuted. Either true or false.

getParticipantListForConference2.doc: Returns the list of participants in the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

ConferenceSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

Muted.doc: Only show participants that are muted or unmuted. Either true or false.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

RecordingSid.doc: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

getRecordingListForAccount.doc: Returns a recording list associated with this {AccountSid}

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

CallSid.doc: Show only recordings made during the call given by this sid.

DateCreated.doc: Only show recordings created on the given date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such					as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or before midnight on a date, and					DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or after midnight on a date.

getRecordingListForCall.doc: Returns a recording list for the {CallSid}

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

CallSid.doc: Show only recordings made during the call given by this sid.

DateCreated.doc: Only show recordings created on the given date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such					as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or before midnight on a date, and					DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or after midnight on a date.

getSandbox.doc: Returns the Sandbox resource associated with the account identified by {AccountSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

getSMS.doc: Returns a single SMS message specified by the provided {SMSMessageSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

SMSMessageSid.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this SMSMessage

getSMSList.doc: Returns a list of SMS messages associated with your account identified by {AccountSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

From.doc: Only show SMS messages from this phone number

To.doc: Only show SMS messages to this phone number.

DateSent.doc: Only show SMS messages sent on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Example: DateSent=2009-07-06. You can also specify					inequality, such as DateSent lt YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages that were sent on or before midnight on a date, and DateSent					gt YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages sent on or after midnight on a date.

getTranscription.doc: Returns a single Transcription resource representation identified by the given {TranscriptionSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

TranscriptionSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource

getTranscriptionList.doc: Returns a set of Transcription resource representations that includes paging information, sorted by 'DateUpdated', with					most recent transcripts first.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

getTranscriptionListForRecording.doc: Each Recording instance resource has a Transcriptions subresource which represents the set of transcriptions generated					from the recording (if any). Represents the set of transcriptions available for the recording identified by					{RecordingSid}.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

RecordingSid.doc: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

From.doc: The phone number to use as the caller id. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Must be					a Twilio number or a valid outgoing caller id for your account.

To.doc: The number to call formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept					unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

Url.doc: The fully qualified URL that should be consulted when the call connects. Just like when you set a URL for your inbound					calls.

Method.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the required Url parameter's value above. Defaults to POST.

FallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

FallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that Twilio should use to request the FallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

StatusCallback.doc: A URL that Twilio will request when the call ends to notify your app.

StatusCallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

SendDigits.doc: A string of keys to dial after connecting to the number. Valid digits in the string include: any digit (0-9), '#' and					'*'. For example, if you connected to a company phone number, and wanted to dial extension 1234 and then the pound key,					use SendDigits=1234#. Remember to URL-encode this string, since the '#' character has special meaning in a URL.

IfMachine.doc: Tell Twilio to try and determine if a machine (like voicemail) or a human has answered the call. Possible values are					Continue and Hangup. See the answering machines section below for more info.

Timeout.doc: The integer number of seconds that Twilio should allow the phone to ring before assuming there is no answer. Default is					60 seconds, the maximum is 999 seconds. Note, you could set this to a low value, such as 15, to hangup before reaching					an answering machine or voicemail. Also see the answering machine section for other solutions.

modifyLiveCall.doc: Modifies a live call. Modification could be redirection or termination of the call.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

CallSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource

Url.doc: A valid URL that returns TwiML. Twilio will immediately redirect the call to the new TwiML.

Method.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

Status.doc: Either canceled or completed. Specifying canceled will attempt to hangup calls that are queued or ringing but not affect					calls already in progress. Specifying completed will attempt to hang up a call even if it's already in progress.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

ConferenceSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

CallSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.

Muted.doc: Specifying true will mute the participant, while false will un-mute.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account.

From.doc: A Twilio number enabled for SMS. Only phone numbers purchased from Twilio work here; you cannot (for example) spoof SMS					messages from your own cell phone number.

To.doc: The number to call. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept					unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

Body.doc: The text of the message you want to send, limited to 160 characters.

StatusCallback.doc: A URL that Twilio will POST to when your message is processed. Twilio will POST the SmsSid as well as SmsStatus=sent or					SmsStatus=failed.

updateAccountByPost.doc: Allows you to modify the 'FriendlyName' for the {AccountSid} via POST.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

FriendlyName.doc: The human-readable description of an account.

Status.doc: Alter the status of this account: use closed to irreversibly close this account, suspended to temporarily suspend it, or active to reactivate it.

updateAccountByPut.doc: Allows you to modify the 'FriendlyName' for the {AccountSid} via PUT.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

FriendlyName.doc: The human-readable description of an account.

Status.doc: Alter the status of this account: use closed to irreversibly close this account, suspended to temporarily suspend it, or active to reactivate it.

updateIncomingPhoneNumberByPost.doc: Update an incoming phone number obtained from Twilio via POST.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

IncomingPhoneNumberSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number resource, with maximum length 64 characters.

ApiVersion.doc: Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version. Either 2010-04-01 or 2008-08-01.

VoiceUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the phone number.

VoiceMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by VoiceUrl.

VoiceFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

StatusCallback.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

StatusCallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST.

SmsUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the new phone number.

SmsMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

SmsFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceCallerIdLookup.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

updateIncomingPhoneNumberByPut.doc: Update an incoming phone number obtained from Twilio via PUT.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

IncomingPhoneNumberSid.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number resource, with maximum length 64 characters.

ApiVersion.doc: Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version. Either 2010-04-01 or 2008-08-01.

VoiceUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the phone number.

VoiceMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by VoiceUrl.

VoiceFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

StatusCallback.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

StatusCallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST.

SmsUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the new phone number.

SmsMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsFallbackUrl.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

SmsFallbackMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

VoiceCallerIdLookup.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

updateOutgoingCallerIdByPost.doc: Updates the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid} and returns the updated resource if					successful via POST.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

OutgoingCallerIdSid.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of a Caller ID, with maximum length of 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted					version of the phone number.

updateOutgoingCallerIdByPut.doc: Updates the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid} and returns the updated resource if					successful via PUT.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

OutgoingCallerIdSid.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

FriendlyName.doc: A human readable description of a Caller ID, with maximum length of 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted					version of the phone number.

updateSandboxByPost.doc: Updates the Sandbox resource via POST.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

VoiceMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the above URL. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the sandbox.

SmsMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

updateSandboxByPut.doc: Updates the Sandbox resource via PUT.

AccountSid.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

VoiceMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the above URL. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

SmsUrl.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the sandbox.

SmsMethod.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.
